## Syllabus Fall 2009:


  


### Day 1 (W. Sept. 30, 50 minutes)


  
[Lecture1.pdf](http://brianomeara.info/sites/default/files/2009ix30_UTKEEB_Core_Phylogenetics1_V06.pdf)
  
Readings: [Gregory 2008](http://www.springerlink.com/content/v41w288751r82653/), [Crisp and Cook 2005](http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.tree.2004.11.010)
  
Topics:
  
What trees are used for
  
history of life + cool discoveries about topology
  
Tree terminology
  
clades (dinos birds, reptiles, fish)
  
sister groups, crown/stem, etc.
  
rank and its importance
  
homology
  

  


### Day 2 (F. Oct. 2, 50 minutes) 


  
[Lecture2.pdf](http://brianomeara.info/sites/default/files/2009x02_UTKEEB_Core_Phylogenetics2_V04.pdf)
  
Readings: [Felsenstein 1978](http://www.jstor.org/stable/2412923).
  
Topics:
  
Treespace/NP-nasty
  
History
  
Distance
  
Parsimony
  
Long branch attraction
  

  


### Day 3 (M. Oct. 5, 2 hr) 


  
[Lecture3.pdf](http://brianomeara.info/sites/default/files/2009x05_UTKEEB_Core_Phylogenetics3_V05.pdf)
  
Readings:  [Huelsenbeck et al. 2002](http://sysbio.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/content/abstract/51/5/673)
  
Topics:
  
Models
  
Model selection
  
Bayes/Likelihood
  
Sample analysis walkthrough (genbank, alignment, tree search, sketch of posttree analysis)
  

  


### Day 4 (W. Oct. 7, 50 minutes) 


  
[Lecture4.pdf](http://brianomeara.info/sites/default/files/2009x07_UTKEEB_Core_Phylogenetics4_V07.pdf)
  
Readings: none.
  
Topics:
  
Bootstrap
  
Clocking
  

  


### Day 5 (F. Oct. 9, 50 minutes) 


  
[Lecture5.pdf](http://brianomeara.info/sites/default/files/2009x09_UTKEEB_Core_Phylogenetics5_V04.pdf)
  
Readings: [Edwards 2009](http://www.bioone.org/doi/abs/10.1111/j.1558-5646.2008.00549.x), [Hugall et al. 2007](http://sysbio.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/content/full/56/4/543)
  
Topics:
  
Supertrees
  
Supermatrices
  
Gene tree species tree
